result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: this case dismissed and read-in with 14cf102

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle D. Boelk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyle D. Boelk in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  this case dismissed and read-in with 14cf102
Faxed copy from Bayfield County Jail.  They are sending original to us either via mail or through jail transfer.

Defendant shall have no contact with minor children.
Defendant shall comply with the rules of the sex offender registry.
Defendant shall maintain residence at 52240 Lake Road,  Barnes, Wisconsin.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant Kyle D. Boelk in court, appearing from custody by video from Bayfield County Jail, with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF requests bond modification, signature bond.  State does not object.  Court lowers bond to $250 cash with same conditions.  
DE  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle D. Boelk in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Kyle D. Boelk in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Acknowledges receipt of information. DEF enters NG plea,  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kyle D. Boelk in court with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Kyle D. Boelk in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waived preliminary hearing which was scheduled for today.  Court binds DE over.  Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle D. Boelk in court via video means with Attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Kyle D. Boelk in custody.  Bruce Poquette appeared on behalf of John M Yackel for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  DE waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  DE on probation hold currently.  Bond continues as previously set.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant shall have no contact with minor children.
Defendant shall comply with the rules of the sex offender registry.
Defendant shall maintain residence at 52240 Lake Road,  Barnes, Wisconsin.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant REFUSED to sign the cash bond.

District Attorney Bruce Poquette appeared in court. Defendant appeared in court in person in custody. Cash bond set at $1,000 with conditions:No contact with minor children, comply with rules of sex offender registry and to maintain Lake Rd. residence. Next court date to be on 06-24-14 at 8:30.
